docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 3.-- Several persons were injured yesterday when police, with drawn sabres, dispersed a demonstration staged before Government House by communists protesting against the conviction for murder in the United States of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 3.-- Several persons were injured yesterday when police, with drawn sabres, dispersed a demonstration staged before Government House by communists protesting against the conviction for murder in the United States of the Italians Sacco and Vanzetti.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan police break up demonstration in Montevideo

headline.main: DISPERSE MONTEVIDEO REDS; Uruguayan Police Break Up Demonstration Against Americans.

docs.snippet: FLORENCE, Ala., Dec. 3.--Arriving here today with Thomas A. Edison for a three days' inspection of the Muscle Shoals nitrate and waterpower projects, Henry Ford told for the first time the  reason why he wishes to lease and operate the great plant.
docs.lead_paragraph: FLORENCE, Ala., Dec. 3.--Arriving here today with Thomas A. Edison for a three days' inspection of the Muscle Shoals nitrate and waterpower projects, Henry Ford told for the first time the reason why he wishes to lease and operate the great plant.
docs.abstract: Ford and Edison inspect plant; Ford suggests plan to finance completion of dam by substituting energy dollar for gold as basis of currency; outlines reasons for wishing to obtain control, principal one being his desire to end war

headline.main: FORD HOPES TO USE MUSCLE SHOALS AS STEP TO END WARS; Wants the Government to Issue Non-Interest Notes to Cover Cost of Completion. POWER WOULD BE SECURITY Plans to Show the World Natural Resources and Not GoldShould Be Behind Currency.BLAMES BANKERS' CONTROLPeace Will Come. He Says, WithBreaking of Gold Monopoly--Heand Edison Inspect Dam. Would Keep Gold for the Arts. Determined to End Wars. FORD WOULD USE SHOALS TO END WAR Would Simply Issue Currency. Would Use Power as Money Unit. Ford and Edison Inspect Dam.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Dec. 14 (Associated Press).-- Pending the formal exchange of Ambassadors, Germany will send Theodor Lang as Charge d'Affaires to Washington. Herr Lang also will retain his appointment as Consul General at New York, but will be represented...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Dec. 14 (Associated Press).-- Pending the formal exchange of Ambassadors, Germany will send Theodor Lang as Charge d'Affaires to Washington. Herr Lang also will retain his appointment as Consul General at New York, but will be represented there by a Vice Consul while serving at Washington.
docs.abstract: C Lang will be German Consul in N Y and act as charge d'affaires in Washington until Amb is appointed; Dr A Hermes may be named Amb

headline.main: LANG COMING HERE AS GERMAN CHARGE; To Act at Washington and Also as New York Consul Until Ambassador Is Named. HERMES SLATED FOR POST? "German Hoover" Is Said to Have Been Chosen, but State Department Is Uninformed.
